thread.title: OCCI praises govt’s care for private sector
thread.title_full: OCCI praises govt’s care for private sector

author: Times of Oman
title: OCCI praises govt’s care for private sector
text:
Muscat: The Board of Oman Chamber of Commerce and Industry (OCCI) reaffirmed the government’s care and attention for supporting the private sector and empowering it to play its aspired roles for integration with the Sultanate’s economy system.
The private sector has witnessed tangible and efficient activity in economic development during the year 2023 and was proactive in the field of economic diversification.
The above reaffirmations came during the eighth meeting of the Board of Oman Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year, chaired by Faisal bin Abdullah Al Rawas, Chairman of Oman Chamber of Commerce and Industry in the presence of the members of the board.
The meeting approved conducting a competitive study of business in the Sultanate of Oman as reference for all departments of the State in order to improve the business environment.
The meeting also approved inviting tenders for conducting a study on the challenges of finance faced by the sectors of economic diversification.
The OCCI Board approved during the meeting the Budget for 2024, which included activities and events in the governorates of the Sultanate in line with the plans and strategies of Oman Chamber of Commerce and Industry. The meeting also tackled issues of concern to economy and supportive to business environment and enhancement of partnership and cooperation with the various departments. The board also reviewed the support of the governorates in 2024 and the projects and activities of OCCI in its branches in the governorates.
